channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Xiaomi's Mi 11 Ultra has a tiny selfie screen on the back
item.description: Xiaomi's Mi 11 Ultra is the first smartphone to utilize Samsung's more powerful ISOCELL GN2 sensor for its main camera, and to get the most out of it, the device packs a small screen next to the rear cameras for higher-quality selfies.

item.title: SolarWinds hack reportedly accessed emails for key DHS officials
item.description: SolarWinds hackers reportedly compromised the email of Homeland Security officials, including acting Secretary Chad Wolf.

item.title: A Jony Ive-designed Leica camera prototype is going up for auction
item.description: The final prototype version of a Leica M camera designed by Jony Ive is going up for auction in June.

item.title: Otterbox’s new accessories are aimed at kids and their iPads
item.description: OtterBox finally has a line of rugged iPad accessories for kids.

item.title: Apple's MacBook Air M1 returns to $950 on Amazon
item.description: Apple's lightweight MacBook Air with its M1 system-on-a-chip is back on sale at Amazon for $950.

item.title: Misusing Ford’s 2021 F-150 pickup generator
item.description: The 2021 Ford F-150 pickup has a generator that can power your tools, and even a small scale construction site. So of course, we made pizza bagels with it.

item.title: Boston Dynamic's new 'Stretch' robot is designed for boxes, not backflips
item.description: Boston Dynamics has revealed its latest robot, Stretch, designed for far less glamorous purposes than its other creations.

item.title: The Morning After: Peacock is reassessing 17,000 hours of WWE content
item.description: Today’s headlines: New York rolls out first digital COVID-19 vaccine passports in the US, MIT study finds labeling errors in datasets used to test AI and Peacock is removing racist scenes from classic WWE matches.

item.title: Amazon sale cuts up to $55 off its Fire HD tablets
item.description: Amazon has cut the prices on its Fire range of tablets to get more people using its apps and services.

item.title: Amazon's one-day storage sale includes big savings on SanDisk's 1TB microSD card
item.description: If you're looking to boost storage on your smartphone, Switch or other device, Amazon is offering some steep discounts on SanDisk's highest capacity microSD cards as part of its deal of the day.

item.title: Uber adds all-electric vehicles to its list of ride options in London
item.description: Uber users in central London can request an all-electric vehicle instead of a regular ICE or hybrid car.

item.title: MIT study finds labelling errors in datasets used to test AI
item.description: Over three percent of data in the most-cited datasets was deemed inaccurate or mislabeled.

item.title: NASA's TESS spacecraft has already found 2,200 possible planets
item.description: NASA's TESS spacecraft has already found 2,200 potential planets, surpassing its original goal and raising hope of finding Earth-like worlds.

item.title: Amazon's rotating Echo Show 10 is $40 off at Amazon
item.description: Amazon's automatically rotating Echo Show 10 smart display is on sale for $40 off, and there are discounts on other devices as well.

item.title: New York rolls out first digital COVID-19 vaccine passports in the US
item.description: New York state has launched the US' first vaccine passports in the form of the mostly digital Excelsior Pass, but it's bound to stir ethical debates.

item.title: Target aching muscles with this 20-speed percussion massage gun
item.description: Designed to get as close as possible to a professional massage, the Actigun 2.0 works to relieve muscle tension after exercising, which can improve recovery time and make post-workout discomfort all but disappear.

item.title: Apple Watch can monitor the frailty of cardiovascular patients at home
item.description: A Stanford study has determined that the Apple Watch can monitor the frailty of cardiovascular disease patients when they're at home — it's about as good as a clinic.

item.title: This is the most detailed picture of a black hole to date
item.description: Scientists have captured an image of the M87 galaxy's black hole showing how it looks in polarized light, revealing the shape of key magnetic fields.

item.title: Peacock is removing racist scenes from classic WWE matches
item.description: NBCUniversal's Peacock is removing racist scenes from classic WWE matches as it comes to terms with a troublesome streaming catalog.

item.title: Scotland’s renewable energy matched 97 percent of demand in 2020
item.description: 97.4 percent of Scotland's gross electric consumption came from clean energy sources in 2020.

item.title: 'Hamster ball' robot could explore Moon caves
item.description: The ESA is backing a 'hamster ball' robot, DAEDALUS, that would explore Moon caves for signs of water ice and even potential settler sites.

item.title: Vizio's rotating Dolby Atmos soundbar is $200 off at Amazon
item.description: Vizio's rotating Elevate soundbar has received a $200 discount at Amazon, making it a better deal if you want wireless Dolby Atmos in a compact size.

item.title: Facebook freezes Venezuela president's page over false COVID-19 claims
item.description: Facebook has frozen the page of Venezuela president Maduro for a month for posting COVID-19 misinformation.

item.title: Hitting the Books: Extraterrestrial careers and the power of human cultural bias
item.description: Mathematics may be considered a universal constant — and surefire way to communicate with extraterrestrials — but there's no guarantee that the next spacefaring civilization we come in contact with will understand the universe the way we do.

item.title: Protect your home with a private security camera powered by blockchain technology
item.description: Ucam is a completely private security camera you can operate from your phone. With two-way audio, motion detection and 360-degree views, you can monitor your home from anywhere.
